*div1 type="summary"* *p*Nathaniel Cox to Austin, May 27, 1825. Shipping Austin's books. Cotton now 35 cents a pound. Groce should gin and sell.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="05-27-1825">27 May 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir,*/p*
*p*You were advised some few weeks ago of the safe arrival of your Box of Books—I have now an opportunity of sending them by the *person_mentioned*bearer*/person_mentioned*, which I embrace, and hope they will reach you in safety*/p*
*p*I have not very lately heard from *person_mentioned*Mrs Hawkins*/person_mentioned*, but believe herself and *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*are well—She still lives with her younger *person_mentioned*sister*/person_mentioned* the only one of that *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*that is independent and able to give her a support—I hope the time is not far distant when such charity will be unnecessary—From the great numbers of persons passing through to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*I feel assured your *location_mentioned*Province */location_mentioned*will soon fill up and Enable you to make sale of lands.*/p*
*p*What is *person_mentioned*Mr Gross*/person_mentioned* doing with his cotton—The price is now an object—35 Cts. I should suppose it would be well worth getting ginned and shipped immediately.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Nath: Cox*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Colo. Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
